item.title: Git subtree
item.author: hello@akimul.com (Akimul Islam Akash)
item.description: Suppose, we have repository. We want to share another repository as a library between multiple repositories. In that case, we subtree the shared repository in other repositories. Usage and Commands: Let say, we have two repository parent and child. We want to use the child repo as subtree library in the parent repo. Initially, parent --a.py --b.py and child child --c.py --d.py adding subtree In order to add the child repo as subtree to the parent repo:

item.title: Django-webpack
item.author: hello@akimul.com (Akimul Islam Akash)
item.description: In this post, I will show you how to configure Webpack and ES6 in Django application. I guess you already know django and want to configure webpack in your django app, this post will show you step by step guide. Tech Stack Python3 Django 1.11 Webpack4 NPM Javascript (ES6) Environment setup & Requirements Before getting started, please make sure that the followings are already installed on your system:
